title: OT112: Opentagon Thread
summary:
Key ideas:
- The post is an open thread where readers can post about anything they want.
- The author is retiring his old email and using a new one for communication.
- The comment of the week is a set of tweets discussing the benefits of adversarial collaboration contests.
- The author is interested in publishing any good adversarial collaboration contest and is behind on paying some people.
- The author is trying to keep the comments section balanced and has decided to keep some leftist commenters around with warnings.

Key learnings:
- Readers can use the open thread to discuss any topic they want.
- The author has a new email for communication.
- Adversarial collaboration contests can benefit participants and democracy.
- Anyone who wants to participate in an adversarial collaboration can reach out to the author.
- The author is trying to keep the comments section balanced and is practicing affirmative action for left-wing commenters.

Key questions:
- What topics will readers discuss in the open thread?
- How do readers contact the author through the new email?
- What are the requirements for participating in an adversarial collaboration contest?
- How does the author decide which adversarial collaborations to publish?
- What counts as more serious issues that may lead to banning on the comments section?
